basics.name: Michelle Bueno Vásquez
basics.label: Political Science Ph.D. Candidate, Applied Statistics MS Candidate
basics.summary: Researcher focusing on the measure of race, ethnicity, intersectional identity, and their political implications, with a diasporic and transnational focus on Afro-Latino communities in the U.S. and the Caribbean.

education.description:
Field of Study: American Politics and Methodology
Dissertation: Transnational Racial Formation and Charting a Space for Afro-Latinos
Committee: Dr. Reuel Rogers (Chair), Dr. Alvin B. Tillery II, Dr. Chloe Thurston, Dr. James Mahoney, Dr. Danielle Clealand
Master's Thesis: Transnational Racial Ideologies: Raising Black Consciousness through Social Media from the U.S. to the Dominican Republic

B.A. Thesis: The Effects of Race and Socioeconomic Status on Student Self-Perceptions, Views on Political Agency, and Future Success
Faculty Advisor: Dr. Michael Dawson

education.institution: Institute for Multi-Method and Qualitative Research (IQMR)

research_interests.description: My work centers on the measure of race, ethnicity, intersectional identity, and their political implications. I do this through qualitative and quantitative social science, with a diasporic and transnational focus on Afro-Latino communities in the U.S. and the Caribbean.
